result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alvino W. Rogers Allen

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.

9:44 AM Defendant Alvino W. Rogers Allen in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Alvino W. Rogers Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Calendar call on September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:57 AM Defendant Alvino W. Rogers Allen in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy by video.  David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court takes judicial notice of 20CF705. Officer Joshua Solturas sworn in and testfied by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Activity: Initial appearance
